fields.title: X подает в суд на конкурента «Operation Bluebird» за попытку «украсть» фирменный стиль Twitter
fields.content: «Twitter никуда не исчез». Спустя неделю после петиции о возврате имени и птицы Twitter X Маска подал встречный иск к «Operation Bluebird» за нарушение авторских прав.

fields.title: Waymo возобновила сервис беспилотных такси после блэкаута в Сан-Франциско, сбившего машины с толку
fields.content: Отключение электроэнергии, оставившее без света 130 000 домов по всему Сан-Франциско, также вынудило оператора роботакси Waymo приостановить работу: беспилотные автомобили застряли у погасших светофоров.

fields.title: Какие европейские страны рассматривают запрет соцсетей для детей?
fields.content: На фоне запрета Австралии на социальные сети для детей младше 16 лет, вступившего в силу в начале месяца, европейские страны пытаются решить, стоит ли вводить аналогичные ограничения.

fields.title: От vibe-кодинга до более быстрых моделей: что нового в обновлении Google Gemini
fields.content: Накануне праздничного сезона Google представила свежий набор обновлений для Gemini, своего ассистента на базе искусственного интеллекта (ИИ), подчеркивая стремление технологического гиганта не отставать в стремительно развивающейся гонке ИИ.

fields.title: Spotify расследует утечку данных после заявления пиратской группы о сборе данных из своей медиатеки
fields.content: Стриминговая платформа Spotify в понедельник подтвердила, что ее библиотека была собрана третьей стороной, после того как группа пиратских активистов заявила, что опубликовала метаданные всего музыкального каталога платформы.

fields.title: ChatGPT запускает итоги 2025 года в стиле Spotify Wrapped для миллионов пользователей
fields.content: Представьте это цифровым дневником: не неловкая история прослушиваний в Spotify, а скорее ваши ночные экзистенциальные рассуждения и сомнительные житейские советы, которые вы выпрашивали у чат-бота.

fields.title: Робот-подружка и губная помада с ИИ: самые необычные изобретения 2025 года
fields.content:
Однако некоторые из самых запоминающихся открытий были совсем неожиданными, порой причудливыми, показав, насколько креативным может быть мир технологий.

Мы сделали подборку самых необычных изобретений уходящего года - от роботов-помощников для домашних животных и аппликаторов губной помады с искусственным интеллектом до чехла для телефона, который горит, как человеческая кожа.

NE, робот-гуманоид, который может убираться, танцевать и находить ваши ключи

Роботы, которые когда-то казались нам фантастикой далёкого будущего, становятся реальностью. В числе новейших в этой сфере разработок - NEO.

Представленный в этом году как первый в мире робот-гуманоид для помощи по дому - NEO - может складывать бельё, организовывать пространство в шкафах, расставляя предметы по полкам, поддерживать порядок.

Созданный компанией 1X Home Robots, он реагирует на устные или ручные команды через приложение и изучает ваши предпочтения благодаря встроенной большой языковой модели (LLM).

Благодаря WiFi, Bluetooth и трёхполосной акустике динамикам на борту, он также может использоваться в качестве портативной развлекательной системы.

Woofwoof Lux: машина для мытья собак, оснащённая ИИ

В 2025 году время купания стало немного более футуристичным.

Одна компания разработала капсулу для мытья собак с искусственным интеллектом, которая предлагает индивидуальные режимы мытья в зависимости от породы и типа шерсти вашего питомца.

Woofwoof Lux использует мягкие струи воды и безопасные для животных шампуни, чтобы обеспечить четвероногим тщательную чистку без лишнего стресса.

Пока машина не продаётся, но вы можете побаловать свою собаку мытьем с помощью Woofwoof Lux в Paws 48, тренажёрном зале для собак и груминг-центре в США.

fields.title: В 2025 году ИИ-мусор стал мейнстримом. Интернет готов повзрослеть?
fields.content: От агрессивных чат-ботов на базе ИИ до бессмысленных описаний товаров в интернет-торговле: в 2025 году «ИИ-помои» по-настоящему набрали обороты, засоряя поисковики, торговые площадки и даже официальные коммуникационные каналы Белого дома.

fields.title: 5 способов, которыми ИИ изменил здравоохранение Европы в 2025 году
fields.content:
Euronews Health сосредоточивается на пяти способах, которыми искусственный интеллект изменил сферу здравоохранения в этом году.

Инструменты искусственного интеллекта (ИИ), призванные улучшать здоровье людей, получили широкое распространение в 2025 году, обещая персонализировать медицинскую помощь, ускорять постановку диагнозов, помогать в создании новых лекарств и многое другое.

Финляндия, например, использует ИИ для обучения медицинских работников, Эстония применяет его для анализа медицинских данных, а Испания использует ИИ для выявления заболеваний.

Тем не менее исследования показывают, что ИИ в ближайшее время не должен заменять медицинских специалистов: врачи по-прежнему превосходят ИИ в экстренных ситуациях, а чат-боты на базе ИИ с трудом справляются с проблемами психического здоровьяи рискуют распространять медицинскую дезинформацию.

Есть также серьёзные вопросы безопасности, при этом эксперты в области технологий и контртерроризма предупреждают, что экстремисты могут воспользоваться инструментами ИИ для создания биологического оружия, способного спровоцировать пандемию.

Тем не менее ИИ всё активнее входит в сферу медицины. Вот пять способов, которыми он повлиял на здоровье и благополучие европейцев в этом году.

1. Прогнозирование рисков для здоровья

Учёные разработали модель ИИ, которая может предсказывать более 1000 заболеваний(включая отдельные виды рака, инфаркты и диабет) за более чем десять лет до официальной постановки диагноза.

Хотя инструмент пока не готов к использованию в клиниках, он может помочь исследователям понять, как заболевания развиваются со временем.

Тем временем в этом году появились и другие инструменты ИИ: они помогают предсказывать, приведут ли редкие генетические мутациик заболеванию, оценивать риски для сердечного здоровья женщин на основе анализа их маммограмм, а также выявлять по данным стандартных медицинских обследований биомаркеры хронического стресса.

2. Ускорение диагностики заболеваний

Впервые в Европе в этом году сертифицировали помощника на базе ИИ под названием Prof. Valmed, который помогает врачам в диагностике и лечении, опираясь на массив медицинских данных пациентов.

Появляются и другие диагностические решения. Например, в Великобритании исследователи заявили, что стетоскоп с поддержкой ИИ может выявлять заболевания сердца всего за 15 секунд.

fields.title: Warner Bros призовет акционеров отклонить враждебное поглощение на фоне атак Трампа на Paramount
fields.content:
Этот текст был переведен с помощью искусственного интеллекта и изначально опубликован на английском языке

Ожидается, что Warner Bros Discovery призовет голосовать против враждебного поглощения Paramount. Фонд прямых инвестиций Джареда Кушнера вышел из финансирования.

Ожидается, что Warner Bros Discovery порекомендует акционерам проголосовать против враждебного предложения о поглощении со стороны Paramount Global, сообщают несколько СМИ, что наносит удар по масштабной попытке Paramount на $108 млрд (€92,2 млрд) взять под контроль конкурирующую студию. Euronews обратился к Warner за дополнительным комментарием.

Это произошло после того, как Paramount объявила о намерении в начале декабря обратиться напрямую к акционерам Warner Bros с полностью денежным предложением по $30 за акцию, в обход совета директоров после того, как студия отклонила несколько её предложений о приобретении. Netflix, в свою очередь, предлагает $27,75 за акцию в денежной и акционной форме.

С тех пор как борьба за поглощение обострилась, акции Warner Bros торгуются ближе к $30 за акцию, поднявшись с примерно $24 за акцию в начале месяца.

Почему Warner Bros сейчас так привлекательна?

Борьба за Warner Bros превратилась в проверку того, кто будет доминировать в медиаиндустрии США.

Кто бы ни приобрёл компанию, получит доступ к обширной библиотеке фильмов и студийного контента под брендом Warner Bros, а также к контенту HBO и франшизе DC Comics, включающей знаковые персонажи вроде Бэтмена и Супермена.

Цена акций компании считалась заниженной на фоне высокого долга и жёсткой конкуренции со стороны Netflix, Amazon и Apple.

5 декабря Netflix сделал официальное предложение по приобретению Warner Bros Discovery, которое совет директоров компании согласился поддержать и которое включало HBO Max и HBO, после многомесячной напряжённой борьбы за актив.

В заявлении стриминговый гигант подтвердил гигантскую сделку на $82,7 млрд (€71 млрд), которую позиционируют как объединение «двух величайших в мире компаний, рассказывающих истории, чтобы принести ещё большему числу людей развлечения, которые они любят смотреть больше всего», сказал тогда генеральный директор и президент Warner Bros Дэвид Заслав.

Если Warner Bros расторгнет действующее соглашение с Netflix, компания должна будет выплатить отвергнутому стримеру компенсацию в $2,8 млрд (€2,4 млрд).

Тем не менее Paramount предстоит преодолеть ряд препятствий, прежде чем она сможет заявить о победе над Netflix: критики, в частности, ставят под сомнение финансирование предложения.

fields.title: «Белый город» Баку: город для людей, а не для машин
fields.content: Устойчивая архитектура, зелёные зоны и общественное искусство формируют повседневную жизнь, а местный бизнес и предприниматели — сильную идентичность сообщества. Жители отмечают, что планировка района поддерживает благополучие, семейную жизнь и общение — отражая переход к городскому планированию в Баку, ориентированному на людей.

fields.title: Крупнейшие универмаги США борются с TikTok и Amazon за покупателей косметики
fields.content:
Бьюти-бары, автоматическое наращивание ресниц и VR-замки XVIII века: отделы красоты крупнейших сетей универмагов выходят на новый уровень, поскольку соцсети и электронная коммерция изменили рынок красоты в США, объем которого составляет 129 млрд долларов.

Раньше рождественский шопинг означал переполненные галереи универмагов, где под мерцающими огнями и за праздничными витринами толкались искатели подарков.

Теперь рождественский шопинг претерпел значительные изменения: покупатели наполняют товарами чулки, сидя на диване, а не под присмотром продавцов-консультантов в красно-зеленых свитерах.

Именно такие покупатели, как Куинн Келси, не дают спать по ночам руководителям универмагов.

38-летняя жительница Денвера черпает идеи для макияжа из видеороликов в TikTok и других социальных сетях, а не у продавцов в косметических магазинах. Она использует чат-бота с искусственным интеллектом, чтобы получить рекомендации по продуктам, которые соответствуют ее бюджету, и посмотреть, как на ней будет смотреться тот или иной тональный крем или помада. Если она покупает, то обычно на Amazon.

fields.title: Weighing sustainability of real vs. fake Christmas trees horrrrrasho bormii
fields.content: Engineering professor Lorena Grundy says people looking to make a sustainable decision should consider how many years they would use an artificial tree, how they plan to dispose of a real tree, and how the tree was transported.

fields.title: Performing Bach and considering his world  Engineering professor Lorena Grundy says people looking to make a sustainable decision should consider how many years they would use an artificial tree, how they plan to dispose of a real tree, and how the tree was transported.
fields.content: Students in the Performance, Analysis, History class explore and perform on piano the work of Johann Sebastian Bach, regarded among history’s greatest composers. Taught by Jamuna Samuel and Yu Xi Wang, the class contextualizes and demystifies Bach through a historical and geographical lens.

fields.title: Exploring Philadelphia’s petrochemical past
fields.content: For some 150 years, Philadelphia’s lower Schuylkill River was a major hub for petroleum storage, refining, and distribution. Taking into account riverside chemical works, coal-gas plants, and coal-fired power stations, the area should be considered the nation’s first comprehensive petrochemical corridor, says Penn historian Jared Farmer.

fields.title: How climate change affects migration
fields.content:
That’s the topic that Mia McElhatton, a fourth-year philosophy major from Philadelphia, is exploring in her research with an undergraduate research grant from the Andrea Mitchell Center for the Study of Democracy and an Association of Alumnae Rosemary D. Mazzatenta Scholars Award.

She is examining both mobility and immobility, which are core to understanding the effects of climate change. “Climate-induced mobility can represent a distinct harm,” she says.

Much of her research so far has been reviewing prior literature, investigating sources in political science, economics, population studies, legal scholarship, and philosophy. She has interviewed people involved with forced migration efforts and has received special support and guidance on climate change politics from Guy Grossman, co-director of the Penn Development Research Initiative. She plans to also examine studies of specific geographic areas and find testimonies on migration’s causes and effects. “A lot of it is philosophical research, focusing on reading a variety of theoretical frameworks and case studies and thinking out how they fit together,” McElhatton says.

The term “climate refugee,” which has been increasingly used in the media and among policymakers, actually has no legal force or meaning, McElhatton says. “For the legal system to attend to it, we need to articulate what the specific harm is and suggest implications from that for domestic or international legal systems,”

fields.title: Centering joy in AI development and implementation
fields.content:
uch of the research on artificial intelligence and human emotion focuses on potential negative implications and emotional states such as depression, with less focus on joy, gratitude, and connection. But Penn Integrates Knowledge professor Desmond Upton Patton says he and collaborators envision a future where people’s experiences—from social media to banking—are shaped by systems that seek to amplify joy.

“Current tech business models focus primarily on engagement without regard for whether such engagement stems from joy or distress, anger, and frustration,” they write in a new paper published in The Paris Journal on AI & Digital Ethics.

In the paper, the researchers present a framework for instead considering how to incorporate joy in the design and deployment of AI models. They are specifically focused on empowering marginalized communities, who experience greater bias from large language models. The goal of the framework is to assist engineers, designers, and researchers in developing AI models that promote more nuanced, compassionate AI interactions.

“We define joy as both an emotion and a tool for liberation, freedom-building, and reimagining possibility,” says Patton, who has primary appointments in the Annenb

fields.title: A massive chunk of ice, a new laser, and new information on sea-level rise
fields.content:
en years ago, glaciologist Leigh Stearns traveled to her favorite six-kilometer-wide chunk of ice, Greenland’s Helheim Glacier.

As in previous trips, she and her colleagues sought new data on how ocean processes influence glacier behavior. With the continued mass loss of the Greenland Ice Sheet contributing to sea level rise, they wanted to better understand the cause and effect of large iceberg calving events—spectacular and often violent phenomena wherein gargantuan, cliff-like slabs of ice shear off Helheim’s face and plunge into the ocean.

On this trip, Stearns, a professor at the University of Pennsylvania, and her collaborators worked with the U.S. Army’s Cold Regions Research and Engineering Laboratory (CRREL), to install an autonomous laser scanner system (ATLAS)—a Greenland first.

“Greenland’s a really tough place to put fragile machinery like this,” Stearns says, noting the lack of power and internet, the intensely cold and windy conditions, as well as occasional visits from polar bears.

(Top) Leigh Stearns, professor in the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences at the Penn, studies glacier dynamics to uncover how and why these massive rivers of ice evolve and what their changes reveal about the planet’s response to natural and human-driven climate forces. (Bottom left) To capture Helheim Glacier’s movements, Stearns and her collaborators worked with the U.S. Army’s Cold Regions Research and Engineering Laboratory to install the Autonomous Terrestrial Laser Scanning system (ATLAS). (Images: Courtesy of Leigh Stearns and CRREL)
 
 

The system mapped Helheim’s three-dimensional surface features every few hours—similar to a mounted camera taking photos for a time lapse—even during months of darkness, delivering continuous, high-resolution data that “is already paying off by helping us see how glaciers actually respond to a changing climate, and what that means in the decades ahead,” Stearns says.

fields.title: Monumental sculpture celebrated on Penn’s campus
fields.content:
n Nov. 8, the University of Pennsylvania revealed “Rui Rui,” a monumental addition to the Penn Art Collection. At 23 feet tall and 19,608 pounds, the cast-iron bust is a quiet giant whose mirage-like exterior belies its solid construction. The work of Spanish sculptor Jaume Plensa, the massive form is modeled and named after his daughter-in-law and continues the artist’s contemplation of the human head in awe-inspiring scale.

The sculpture is the gift of Glenn and Amanda Fuhrman, who are Penn alumni, philanthropists, and long-standing patrons of the arts.

 
View large image
Penn alumni Amanda and Glenn Fuhrman.

(Image: Courtesy of Amanda and Glenn Fuhrman)

 

“Penn is a place for cultural and creative vitality, for anyone who walks onto our campus. The sculptures across our grounds exemplify that ethos: they are for students, for Philadelphia, for all,” said Penn President J. Larry Jameson at the sculpture’s unveiling in Harrison Garden, a leafy oasis adjacent to the Penn Museum and the Clifton Center for Medical Breakthroughs. “We are deeply grateful to Glenn and Amanda for sharing our vision and bringing this inspirational work of art to Penn.”

Known for his public sculptures, Plensa’s  work can be seen in cities across Spain, France, Japan, England, Korea, Germany, and Canada. At Penn, “Rui Rui” joins a monumental collection that includes “Brick House,” by artist Simone Leigh, which came to the University on extended loan from the Fuhrmans in 2020. Both sculptures debuted in Venice Biennales and are now campus landmarks. Lynn Smith Dolby, director of the Penn Art Collection, celebrated the latest installation. “‘Rui Rui’ is the first public work by Jaume Plensa in Philadelphia,” said Smith Dolby. “We are honored that it is joining not just the Penn Art Collection and Penn’s sculpture gardens, but our city’s famed tradition of artistic exploration.”

“When we first saw ‘Rui Rui’ in Venice, we were immediately impressed by how the sculpture embodied both gravity and transcendence,” said Amanda Fuhrman. “We are so excited to share this great work with the Penn students and the city of Philadelphia.”

Glenn Fuhrman said, “Bringing ‘Rui Rui’ to Penn holds particular significance. This campus is where I first discovered my love of art as a student, and ‘Rui Rui’ is a masterpiece that I believe will inspire that same appreciation in generations of students to come.”

Amanda Fuhrman graduated in 1995 and is a nonpracticing attorney, previously with Simpson Thacher & Bartlett LLP. She is currently enrolled in The Spirituality Mind Body area of focus Graduate Studies at Teachers College, Columbia University. She was also the deputy executive director of The Millennium Promise Alliance, Inc., a nonprofit focused on eradicating extreme poverty. She is a Trustee of the Brooklyn Museum and the co-founder of The FLAG Award for Teaching Excellence.

Glenn Fuhrman studied finance and art history, receiving his bachelor’s degree from Penn in 1987 and an MBA from the Wharton School the following year. He is one of the founders and managing partners of Tru Arrow Partners, and he is the founder and CEO of Virtru Investment Partners. He is a Trustee of New York-Presbyterian Hospital, the Museum of Modern Art, and the TATE Americas Foundation. He is also a board member of the Institute of Contemporary Art in Philadelphia, the Central Park Conservancy, and Gagosian Gallery, among others. In 2007, he founded The FLAG Art Foundation in New York City as an independent exhibition space.

fields.title: Economics is ‘a unique way of thinking’ to see through the mystery of daily life
fields.content:
These are a few of the questions that School of Arts & Sciences economist Jin Liu is tackling in her research. Liu specializes in international trade and industrial organization, looking at it from a variety of models: trade, industrial organization, and macroeconomics.

She says economics is a way to look at the world. “It’s a unique way of thinking, a system of concepts that you can use to see through the mystery of daily life,” Liu says. “If you don’t know any economic thinking, you may think it’s so vague, that there are no connections between things.” But, she says, with some understanding of economic rules, “you have a better view of what’s going on.”

One of her projects involves looking at the Chinese film industry and the impact of exposing more people to domestically produced movies. More investment in cultural products, Liu says, could create a positive feedback loop “that could be a novel motivation for a protectionism policy.”

fields.title: Nanoparticle blueprints reveal path to smarter medicines
fields.content: Lipid nanoparticles (LNPs) are the delivery vehicles of modern medicine, carrying cancer drugs, gene therapies, and vaccines into cells. Until recently, many scientists assumed that all LNPs followed more or less the same blueprint, like a fleet of trucks built from the same design.

fields.title: Is there an AI bubble and what happens if it bursts?
fields.content:
nvestor Michael Burry—famous for predicting and profiting from the 2008 housing-market collapse—has set his sights on another sector many believe is ‘too big to fail’: Big Tech’s multitrillion-dollar artificial intelligence spending spree. It’s the latest headline-grabbing play from the investor whose original, audacious bet was immortalized in Michael Lewis’s book, “The Big Short.”

With Wall Street’s recent AI-driven gains drawing comparisons to the dot-com era, questions about market fragility are resurfacing—just as “The Big Short” film marks its tenth anniversary and Burry’s original housing bet hits the 20-year mark—leaving many wondering if we're witnessing unprecedented economic growth or the precursors to another bubble.

Most experts agree that something bubble-like is taking shape, says Itay Goldstein, a financial crises expert at the Wharton School, “but there’s more to it than that.”

What makes a bubble a bubble

At its core, a financial bubble occurs when asset prices rise significantly higher than their fundamental value, says Goldstein, adding that an asset is anything people buy because they expect it to hold or gain value over time, such as a share of stock, a house, a bond, or even a cryptocurrency.

“The challenge with fundamental value, however,” Goldstein says, “is that it is not a fixed, universally agreed upon number. Its calculation is subject to debate because it depends entirely on the financial models and assumptions used.” For example, two investors can look at the same company—its future earning power, risks associated with it, and the like—and reach very different conclusions about what its stock should be worth.

Bubbles usually begin when investors buy because they genuinely believe something is undervalued. Over time, as prices keep rising, the motivation shifts, says Goldstein. “People stop asking, “What is this worth?’ and start asking, ‘How much higher can it go?’” 

Not all bubbles are alike

Bubbles don’t always wreak havoc on the broader economy, Goldstein says. The danger, he explains, lies in exposure—how many people and institutions are tied to a particular asset or sector, and how much they have borrowed to finance those bets.

As an example, he notes how the dot-com bubble of the late 1990s was painful for investors but relatively contained for the general public.

“It was mostly a story about private capital chasing internet startups,” he says. “When it burst, households didn’t lose their homes, and the banking system stayed intact.” But, by contrast, the housing bubble of the 2000s had far-reaching consequences.

Today, more households own stocks through individual brokerages and retirement plans than in the late 1990s, and many of those funds are heavily weighted toward large technology companies.

“This bubble is concentrated in the ‘Magnificent Seven,’ the biggest tech companies that drive much of the S&P 500’s daily price moves,” Goldstein says. “If their valuations fall, a lot of portfolios are going to take a hit,” even for people who think they are just passively saving for retirement.

Seeing a bubble is easy; making money off of one is hard

Contrary to popular belief, bubbles aren’t always invisible

fields.title: Startup recognized for milestones in cancer care
fields.content:
When hematologist and physician-scientist Marco Ruella came to Penn from Italy as a postdoctoral fellow in 2012, one of his dreams was to help drive the development of new treatments and cures for patients with lymphoma.

Over the following decade at the Perelman School of Medicine (PSOM), Ruella led multiple bench-to-bedside projects that would help bring that dream to life. Among the outcomes from his research has been the 2021 launch of viTToria Biotherapeutics (viTToria), a startup dedicated to building novel immunotherapies for difficult-to-treat diseases such as T-cell lymphomas. At the 10th annual Penn Center for Innovation’s (PCI) Celebration of Innovation on Dec. 3, viTToria won the Startup of the Year Award for its research and development advancements in cellular therapy for T-cell lymphoma, an aggressive type of blood cancer with few FDA-approved treatments.

“I’m very thankful for the support that Penn and PCI have provided, including Penn Medicine’s direct investment into the company,” says Ruella, associate professor of medicine at PSOM and principal investigator in the Ruella Lab at the Center for Cellular Immunotherapies. “Our goal at viTToria is to bring safe and efficacious cellular therapies to as many patients as possible.”

Elevating lymphoma treatments

Ruella and colleagues used genetic engineering—including CRISPR gene-editing technologies—to formulate a CAR (chimeric antigen receptor) T-cell therapy that they hope will be more potent than current CAR T products by removing CD5, an inhibitory molecule normally expressed in T-cells. The CD5-deleted CAR T therapy is then able to target T-cell lymphomas. Given that CAR T products targeting T-cells can lead to immunosuppression by attacking benign T-cells in addition to malignant cells, Ruella says, his team also infuses healthy T-cells into the mix to protect lymphoma patients from infection.

Over the past year, PCI’s achievements have included: 

  • $591 million in funding raised by Penn-affiliated startups
  • 398 new inventions disclosed
  • 99 new patents awarded
  • 26 startups launched
  • 650 commercialization agreements executed
  • Ranked 1st nationally in licensing revenue for the fifth year in a row 

Ruella and his team are observing a very high response rate in clinical trials so far. This is significant, he explains, given that in similar populations, his team would only expect about 20% complete response. Only about one in five patients with T-cell lymphoma survive more than five years after diagnosis.

Currently available blood cancer therapies can be particularly taxing on patients, often involving numerous rounds of treatment and intense side effects. Typically, CAR T-cell therapy is minimally invasive, requiring just one infusion. This shows promise not only for helping patients reach remission, but also for improving quality-of-life during treatment. It may also be applicable to targeting other types of blood cancers, including various subsets of leukemias and lymphomas.

Launching viTToria has enabled Ruella and the team to take pivotal steps toward potentially improving T-cell lymphoma care. They have the resources to generate additional intellectual property around their ideas and pursue clinical trials, with the goal of bringing new treatments from the lab to patients.

“The idea to start viTToria was really to create an entire [research and development] platform to support the development of this concept of CAR T-cell [therapy] for T-cell lymphoma,” says Ruella, crediting fellow viTToria co-founders Bruce Peacock and Nicholas Siciliano with leading the process of raising the initial funds to launch and support the startup, and Agent Capital for being viTToria’s founding investor.

“[We’re] very thankful to our investors that have believed in us,” and Ruella, who previously won PCI’s Inventor of the Year Award in 2024.

A legacy of Penn mentorship

Ruella notes the vital role of Penn mentors in guiding his development as a physician-scientist, including Carl H. June, Richard W. Vague Professor in Immunotherapy; Saar Gill, professor of medicine in the division of hematology-oncology; and Stephen J. Schuster, director of the lymphoma translational research program at the Abramson Cancer Center.

“I felt really empowered by my mentors,” says Ruella, “and I try to do my very best to support the next generation,” noting one of his own mentees, Ruchi Patel, who earned her Ph.D. at Penn, led the preclinical work that helped launch viTToria.

PCI staff, including Mark Engleka and Michael Yocum, routinely meet with Ruella to discuss new intellectual property created by the Ruella Lab, review project progress, and provide guidance on protecting ideas. Such support aligns with PCI’s mission to help translate Penn discoveries and ideas into tangible outcomes and serve as a hub for commercial partnership with the University. “[PCI] is an integral part of my work life, and I am very thankful for their support,” Ruella says.

 
View large image
From left to right: Ben Dibling, PCI managing director and associate vice provost for research; Marco Ruella, associate professor of medicine; Nick Siciliano, co-founder of viTToria Biotherapeutics; Geeta Vemuri, founder and managing partner of Agent Capital; Bruce Levine, the Barbara and Edward Netter Professor in Cancer Gene Therapy at Penn Medicine; Liang Feng, professor of materials science and engineering; Nicola Mason, professor of medicine and pathobiology; Preston Noon, partner and co-founder of Agent Capital; and Dave Meaney, PCI vice provost for research.

(Image: John Donges / Penn Vet)

 

Several other Penn-affiliated inventors and trailblazers were recognized during this year’s PCI Celebration of Innovation, including:

  • Capstan Therapeutics, presented with the Deal of the Year Award, in recognition of its ongoing clinical evaluation of an in vivo CAR T therapy and its successful acquisition by AbbVie—accepted by Bruce L. Levine, the Barbara and Edward Netter Professor in Cancer Gene Therapy at PSOM

  • Agent Capital, founding investors in viTToria Biotherapeutics and numerous other Penn spinouts, bestowed with the Paul. D. Sehnert Memorial Partner of the Year Award

fields.title: Electronic medical records help save lives of HIV patients
fields.content: Management and socioeconomic development expert Leandro ‘Leo’ Pongeluppe and colleagues found that switching from paper to electronic medical records at HIV clinics in Malawi led to an estimated 28% reduction in deaths after five years, with the greatest impact on children.

fields.title: Akbarov Abdulhamid Akmal o‘g‘lining falsafa doktori (PhD) dissertatsiyasi himoyasi to‘g‘risida.
fields.content: Akbarov Abdulhamid Akmal o‘g‘lining 08.00.15 – Tadbirkorlik va kichik biznes iqtisodiyoti ixtisosligi bo‘yicha “Kichik biznes va xususiy tadbirkorlik faoliyatida iqtisodiy xavfsizlikni ta’minlash yo‘llari (Andijon viloyati misolida)” mavzusidagi iqtisodiyot fanlari bo‘yicha falsafa doktori (PhD) ilmiy darajasini olish uchun yozilgan dissertatsiya ishi himoyasi Namangan davlat texnika universiteti huzuridagi ilmiy darajalar beruvchi PhD.03/27.05.2020.I.66.03 raqamli Ilmiy kengashning 2026-yil 10 yanvar kuni soat 1000 dagi majlisida bo‘lib o‘tadi.

fields.title: Tanzila Norboyevaning O‘zbekiston xalqiga murojaati
fields.content: O‘zbekiston Respublikasi Oliy Majlisi Senatining Raisi, Korrupsiyaga qarshi kurashish milliy kengashi raisi Tanzila Norboyevaning O‘zbekiston xalqiga  murojaati

fields.title: Eksanova Santalatxon Sharobidinovnaning dissertatsiyasining muhokamasi.
fields.content: 2025-yil 30-dekabr kuni soat 10:00 da Namangan davlat texnika universiteti huzuridagi ilmiy daraja beruvchi PhD.03/30.12.2019.Т.90.01 raqamli Ilmiy Kengash qoshidagi 05.02.02–Mexanizmlar va mashinalar nazariyasi. Mashinashunoslik va mashina detallari hamda 05.07.01–Qishloq xo‘jaligi va melioratsiya mashinalari. Qishloq xo‘jaligi va melioratsiya ishlarini mexanizatsiyalashixtisosliklaribo‘yicha Ilmiy Seminarning navbatdagi majlisibo‘lib o‘tadi.

fields.title: NamDTU rektoriga qutlov xati
fields.content:
Qirg‘iziston davlat texnika universiteti rektori NamDTU rektoriga qutlov xatini yo’lladi!

Quyida ushbu ushbu xat bilan tanishing!
 

Hurmatli Oybek Karimovich!

I.Razzakov nomidagi Qirg‘iziston davlat texnika universiteti jamoasi nomidan hamda shaxsan o‘z nomimdan Sizni Namangan davlat texnika universiteti rektori lavozimiga tayinlanganingiz munosabati bilan samimiy tabriklayman!

Sizga mustahkam sog‘lik, yuksak kasbiy yutuqlar va oliy ta’lim hamda fan sohasini yanada rivojlantirishga qaratilgan samarali faoliyat tilaymiz.

I.Razzakov nomidagi Qirg‘iziston davlat texnika universiteti va Namangan davlat texnika universiteti so‘nggi yillar davomida o‘zaro anglashuv to‘g‘risidagi Memorandum doirasida konstruktiv va samarali hamkorlikni amalga oshirib kelmoqda.

Hamkorlikni yanada rivojlantirish maqsadida, Qirg‘iziston davlat texnika universiteti 2025–2026 o‘quv yilining bahorgi semestridan amaldagi  Memorandum asosida akademik mobillikning turli sohalari doirasida universitet talabalari va professor oʻqituvchilarining ta’lim olishi va tajriba almashishi uchun hamkorlikka ochiq va  tayyor ekanligimizni ma’lum qilamiz.

Hamkorligimizning yanada rivojlanishi mutaxassislar tayyorlash sifatini oshirishga hamda universitetlarimiz o‘rtasidagi sheriklik aloqalarini mustahkamlashga xizmat qilishiga ishonch bildiramiz.

Hurmat bilan,
I.Razzakov nomidagi
Qirg‘iziston davlat texnika universiteti rektori, professor
M.K.Chinibayev

fields.title: NamDTU rektori universitet infratuzilmasini rivojlantirish va obodonlashtirish masalalarini joyida o‘rgandi
fields.content:
NamDTU rektori universitet infratuzilmasini rivojlantirish va obodonlashtirish masalalarini joyida o‘rgandi

Namangan davlat texnika universiteti rektori, professor Oybek Ergashev universitetning Texnologiya hamda Mexanika fakultetlari joylashgan Kosonsoy ko‘chasi, 7-uydagi kampusida bo‘lib, hududni obodonlashtirish, zamonaviy va barqaror infratuzilmalarni shakllantirish masalalari bo‘yicha mas’ul rahbarlar ishtirokida joyida o‘rganish ishlarini olib bordi.

O‘rganish jarayonida kampus hududini kompleks rivojlantirish, ko‘kalamzorlashtirish ishlarini tizimli tashkil etish, manzarali daraxtlarni sovuq ta’siridan asrash hamda ularni agrotexnik talablar asosida to‘g‘ri parvarishlash masalalariga alohida e’tibor qaratildi. Rektor tomonidan hududning ekologik holatini yaxshilash, talaba va professor-o‘qituvchilar uchun qulay, zamonaviy hamda estetik muhit yaratishga qaratilgan aniq topshiriqlar berilib, ularning ijrosini ta’minlash yuzasidan mas’ullarga tegishli vazifalar yuklatildi.

Shuningdek, kampus infratuzilmasini rivojlantirish jarayonida energiya tejamkor yechimlarni joriy etish, dam olish hududlarini zamonaviy talablarga mos holda tashkil etish masalalari muhokama qilindi. Mazkur ishlar universitetda ta’lim sifati va ilmiy muhitni yanada yuksaltirish, shuningdek, talabalarning kundalik faoliyati uchun qulay sharoitlar yaratishga qaratilgan uzoq muddatli rivojlanish strategiyasining muhim tarkibiy qismi ekani ta’kidlandi.

fields.title: Xalqaro hamkorlik va bandlik: NamDTU yangi bosqichda
fields.content:
🇺🇿O‘zbekiston Respublikasi Prezidenti Shavkat Mirziyoyevning Oliy Majlis va xalqimizga yo‘llagan Murojaatnomasida yuqori intellektual salohiyatga ega, raqobatbardosh kadrlar tayyorlash masalasiga alohida e’tibor qaratildi. Xususan, texnika va aniq fanlar yo‘nalishidagi oliygohlarga xorijiy nufuzli universitetlarni jalb etish hamda bitiruvchilar va ish beruvchilar o‘rtasida raqamli “ko‘prik” yaratish tashabbuslari oliy ta’lim tizimi oldiga muhim vazifalarni qo‘ymoqda.

Mazkur raqamli ekotizim orqali talabalar o‘z akademik yutuqlari va kompetensiyalarini real mehnat bozori talablari bilan solishtira oladi, ish beruvchilar esa malakali va tayyor kadrlarni tez va shaffof tarzda topish imkoniyatiga ega bo‘ladi. Bu esa oliy ta’limning eng muhim natijasi — bandlik va ijtimoiy barqarorlikni ta’minlashga xizmat qiladi.

Shu nuqtayi nazardan, Namangan davlat texnika universitetida quyidagi aniq rejalar belgilangan:
🔹 universitetlarning dunyo reytingidagi Top-300 talik ro'yxatida turuvchi Buyuk Britaniyaning "The Univesity of East Anglia" bilan qo'shma ta'lim dasturlarini tashkil etish;
🔹 universitetning texnika sohasiga oid 2 ta bakalavriat taʼlim yoʻnalishi hamda 3 ta magistratura mutaxassisligini xalqaro akkreditatsiyadan oʻtkazish;
🔹 universitetni nufuzli xalqaro tashkilotlar reytingining Top-1000 talik ro‘yxatiga kiritishga tayyorlash;
🔹 talabalarni Yevropa davlatlari, Malayziya, Tailand, Turkiya, Indoneziya, Saudiya Arabistoni va Qozog‘istondagi yetakchi xorijiy universitetlarga almashinuv dasturlari orqali yuborish;
🔹 yetakchi xorijiy universitetlar bilan hamkorlikda tadqiqotchilar uchun ilmiy maktablar, talabalar uchun qishki va yozgi maktablarni tashkil etish;
🔹 ta’lim dasturlarini mehnat bozori ehtiyojlariga moslashtirish va bitiruvchilar kompetensiyalarini kuchaytirish;
🔹 raqamli platformalar orqali talaba–ish beruvchi hamkorligini tizimli yo‘lga qo‘yish.

✔️Bugungi kunda oliy ta’lim muassasalari rahbarlari va mutaxassislari oldida turgan asosiy vazifa — ushbu strategik qarorlarni institutsional darajada samarali amalga oshirish, bitiruvchilarni xalqaro maydonda raqobatbardosh mutaxassislar sifatida tayyorlashdan iborat.

fields.title: Aql-zakovat va masʼuliyatli mehnat — oʻzgarishlarning asosiy omili
fields.content:
#Munosabat

Yakunlanayotgan 2025-yilning eng muhim va yorqin voqealaridan biri, shubhasiz, Oʻzbekiston Respublikasi Prezidentining Oliy Majlis va Oʻzbekiston xalqiga Murojaatnomasi boʻldi. Ushbu Murojaatnomani Namangan davlat texnika universiteti koʻp sonli jamoasi ham bevosita kuzatib bordi.

Prezidentimiz taʼkidlaganidek, boshlangan demokratik islohotlar qatʼiy davom ettirilgani, xalqimizning qoʻllab-quvvatlashi va yoshlarimizning gʻayrat-shijoati hisobiga 2025-yilda barcha sohalarda ulkan yutuqlarga erishildi.

“Bundan toʻqqiz yil oldin iqtisodiyotimiz hajmini 100 milliard dollarga yetkazish biz uchun juda katta marra boʻlib koʻrinardi. Bu yil tariximizda birinchi marta yalpi ichki mahsulotimiz 145 milliard dollardan oshdi. Bunday yuksak natijalar xalqimizning, barchamizning qanday ulkan ishlarga qodir ekanimizni yaqqol namoyon etmoqda», – dedi davlatimiz rahbari.

Yuqori qoʻshilgan qiymat yaratadigan sohalarni rivojlantirish, bioinjeneriyadan keng foydalanish, ilgʻor agrotexnika va suv tejaydigan usullarni faol qoʻllash, “yashil” energetika, chiqindisiz ishlab chiqarishga oʻtish, taʼlim va tibbiyotda ilgʻor xorijiy tajribalarni keng joriy etish, kadrlarni ilm-fan va innovatsiyalarga asoslangan zamonaviy kasblarga tayyorlash orqali kelgusi besh yilda iqtisodiyotimiz hajmini 240 milliard dollardan oshirishga barcha imkoniyatlar borligi taʼkidlandi.

Mana shunday ulkan maqsadlarga erishishda mahalla tizimining oʻrni va taʼsiri beqiyos. Shularni hisobga olib, Prezidentimiz 2026-yilni yurtimizda “Mahallani rivojlantirish va jamiyatni yuksaltirish yili”, deb eʼlon qilishni taklif qildi va ushbu taklif olqishlar bilan qarshi olindi.

Prezidentimiz mazkur Murojaatnomada 2026-yilda amalga oshiriladigan eng muhim ustuvor yoʻnalishlarga alohida toʻxtalib oʻtdi. Jumladan, kasblarni rivojlantirish va yangi mehnat bozori arxitekturasini yaratishga bagʻishlangan toʻrtinchi ustuvor yoʻnalishda kelgusi yili mamlakatimizdagi 15 ta oliygohda sunʼiy intellekt laboratoriyasi faoliyati yoʻlga qoʻyilishi belgilab berildi.

Bu tibbiyot, transport, qishloq xoʻjaligi, geologiya, bank-moliya, jamoat xavfsizligi kabi muhim sohalarda 100 dan ortiq sunʼiy intellekt loyihalarini amalga oshirishga xizmat qiladi.

Faxr bilan aytish mumkinki, ushbu oliygohlar qatorida Namangan davlat texnika universiteti ham bor. Universitetimizda bugungi kunda Asakabank va Xitoyning Huawei kompaniyasi bilan hamkorlikda sunʼiy intellekt laboratoriyasini tashkil etish boʻyicha saʼy-harakatlar boshlab yuborildi.

Murojaatnomada qayd etilganidek, Jizzax politexnika institutini Vengriyaning nufuzli “Abuda” universiteti boshqaruviga berishga qaror qilindi. Oʻzbekistonda “Sukuba” milliy universiteti bilan hamkorlikda aniq fanlar boʻyicha yangi oliygoh tashkil qilish haqida kelishib olindi. Bu tajriba kelgusida davom ettirilib, aniq fanlar va texnika yoʻnalishidagi oliygohlarga dunyoning eng nufuzli universitetlari jalb qilinadi.

Universitetimiz bu boradagi islohotlarga tayyor boʻlib, hozirning oʻzida dunyoning 20 dan ortiq davlatidagi 100 ga yaqin nufuzli oliy taʼlim muassasalari va ilmiy-tadqiqot markazlari bilan mustahkam aloqalar oʻrnatilgan. Jumladan, dunyo reytingidagi top-300 talik roʻyxatida turuvchi Buyuk Britaniyaning “The Univesity of East Anglia” universiteti bilan qoʻshma taʼlim dasturlarini tashkil etish boʻyicha rejalar belgilab olingan.

Davlat rahbari Murojaatnomasida kasbiy taʼlim, xususan, texnikumlarga alohida eʼtibor qaratildi. 2026-yildan boshlab har yili kamida 100 tadan texnikum toʻliq taʼmirlanib, texnologik va talab yuqori boʻlgan kasblarga mos holda jihozlab borilishi, Germaniya, Shveysariya, Buyuk Britaniya, Xitoy, Koreya kabi davlatlarning ilgʻor taʼlim dasturlari joriy qilingan texnikumlar soni 100 taga yetkazilishi maʼlum qilindi.

“Mening niyatim – yoshlarimiz talab yuqori boʻlgan kasblar boʻyicha dunyoda raqobatdosh boʻlsin, kerak boʻlsa, boshqalardan bir pogʻona ustun tursin. Ushbu maqsadga erishish yoʻlida kasbiy taʼlimning eng muhim boʻgʻini boʻlgan texnikumlarni yangi sifat bosqichiga olib chiqamiz”, – dedi Prezidentimiz.Namangan davlat texnika universiteti bugungi kunda viloyatdagi 32 ta texnikum bilan uzviy hamkorlikni yoʻlga qoʻygan. Biz kelgusida ushbu aloqalarni bugungi kun talablaridan kelib chiqqan holda yanada mustahkamlash ustida izchil ish olib boramiz.

Davlat rahbari taʼkidlaganidek, mehnat bozoriga yiliga 300 ming oliy maʼlumotli kadrlar kirib kelmoqda. Endi oliygoh bitiruvchilari va ish beruvchilar oʻrtasida “koʻprik” boʻlib xizmat qiladigan raqamli ekotizim yaratiladi. Ushbu ekotizim bitiruvchi kurs talabalari uchun oʻziga mos ish topish, korxonalarga esa malakali kadrlarni jalb qilish imkonini beradi.

Namangan davlat texnika universitetida “Karyera va bandlik markazi” tashkil etilgan boʻlib, markaz bitiruvchilarimizni munosib ish joylariga ega boʻlishlarida yaqindan koʻmak berib kelmoqda. Shuningdek, universitet kafedralalarining viloyatimizdagi koʻplab yetakchi korxona va tashkilotlarda filiallari tashkil etilgan boʻlib, bu dual taʼlimni joriy etishda oʻzining ijobiy samarasini bermoqda. Kasb, malaka, texnologiya va taʼlimni birlashtiradigan yagona mexanizm asoslari yaratilmoqda.

Muxtasar qilib aytganda, Oʻzbekiston Respublikasi Prezidentining Oliy Majlis va Oʻzbekiston xalqiga Murojaatnomasi Namangan davlat texnika universiteti jamoasi tomonidan muhim dastur sifatida qabul qilindi.

Davlat rahbari taʼkidlaganidek, biz oʻzgarishlarni kutib yashamaymiz, aksincha, ularni oʻzimiz, oʻz aql-zakovatimiz va masʼuliyatli mehnatimiz bilan yaratamiz. Bugun tarixning oʻzi, hayotning oʻzi zimmamizga shunday masʼuliyatni yuklamoqda.

Jamoamiz bu borada oʻz oldiga katta marra va maqsadlarni qoʻygan. Ularni sidqidildan amalga oshirish uchun bor kuch-gʻayratimiz, salohiyat va shijoatimizni sarflashga tayyormiz.

2026-yil universitetimiz uchun ham tub burilish yili boʻladi!

 

Oybek Ergashev
Namangan davlat texnika universiteti rektori, professor.

fields.title: Tyurin Igor Nikolaevich-dissertasiya ishining himoyasi(DSc)
fields.content:
Tyurin Igor Nikolaevichning texnika fanlari doktori (DSc) dissertasiya ishining  himoyasi to‘g‘risida  

 

“Resurstejamkorlik tamoyillariga asoslangan raqamli loyihalash va kiyim ishlab chiqarishning metodologik asoslari” mavzusida.

Tyurin Igor Nikolaevichning  05.06.04-Tikuvchilik buyumlari texnologiyasi va kostyum dizayni ixtisosligi bo‘yicha, “Resurstejamkorlik tamoyillariga asoslangan raqamli loyihalash va kiyim ishlab chiqarishning metodologik asoslari”mavzusida, texnika fanlari doktori (DSc) ilmiy darajasini olish uchun yozilgan dissertasiya ishininghimoyasi Namangan davlat texnika universiteti huzuridagi DSc.03/04.10.2023.Т.174.01 raqamli Ilmiy kengashning 2026-yil 17-yanvarkuni soat 13:30dagi majlisida bo‘lib o‘tadi.  

Manzil: 160103, Namangan shahri, Gulobod MFY,Janubiy aylanma yo‘li ko‘chasi,17-uy.  

Tel/faks:+99869-234-14-85

e-mail: info@namdtu.uz
             namdtu@exat.uz

fields.title: Numonjonova Nargiza Ashuraliyevnaning falsafa doktori (PhD) dissertatsiyasi himoyasi to‘g‘risida
fields.content: Numonjonova Nargiza Ashuraliyevnaning 08.00.15 – Tadbirkorlik va kichik biznes iqtisodiyoti ixtisosligi bo‘yicha «Kichik biznesni rivojlanishida investitsiyalardan foydalanish samaradorligini oshirish yo‘llari (Andijon viloyati misolida)» mavzusidagi iqtisodiyot fanlari bo‘yicha falsafa doktori (PhD) ilmiy darajasini olish uchun yozilgan dissertatsiya ishi himoyasi Namangan davlat texnika universiteti huzuridagi ilmiy darajalarni beruvchi PhD.03/27.05.2020.I.66.03 raqamli Ilmiy kengashning 2026 yil 10 yanvar kuni soat 1200 dagi majlisida bo‘lib o‘tadi.

fields.title: Zulfikarova Dilfuza Gulomjanovnaning falsafa doktori (PhD) dissertatsiyasi himoyasi to‘g‘risida
fields.content: Zulfikarova Dilfuza Gulomjanovnaning 08.00.15 – Tadbirkorlik va kichik biznes iqtisodiyoti ixtisosligi bo‘yicha «Ayollar tadbirkorligini tashkil etish va rivojlantirish(Namangan viloyati misolida)» mavzusidagi iqtisodiyot fanlari bo‘yicha falsafa doktori (PhD) ilmiy darajasini olish uchun yozilgan dissertatsiya ishi himoyasi Namangan muhandislik-texnologiya instituti huzuridagi ilmiy darajalarni beruvchi PhD.03/27.05.2020.I.66.03 raqamli Ilmiy kengashning 2026 yil 13 yanvar kuni soat 1400 dagi majlisida bo‘lib o‘tadi.

fields.title: Yuldasheva Dildora Baxodirjon qizi-dissertasiya ishi himoyasi(PhD)
fields.content:
“Tabiiy ipakdan to‘qima ishlab chiqarish uchun pishitilgan ip tayyorlash texnologiyasini takomillashtirish” mavzusida.

Yuldasheva Dildora Baxodirjon qizining 05.06.02–To‘qimachilik materiallari texnologiyasi va xomashyoga dastlabki ishlov berish ixtisosligi bo‘yicha, “Tabiiy ipakdan to‘qima ishlab chiqarish uchun pishitilgan ip tayyorlash texnologiyasini takomillashtirish” mavzusida, texnika fanlari bo‘yicha falsafa doktori (PhD) ilmiy darajasini olish uchun yozilgan dissertasiya ishining himoyasi Namangan davlat texnika universiteti huzuridagi DSc.03/04.10.2023.Т.174.01 raqamli Ilmiy kengashning 2026-yil 10-yanvar kuni soat 13:30 dagi majlisida bo‘lib o‘tadi.
